item.title: Thoughts on Debugging 2
item.description: tags: iOS Mac Leveling\ Up Debugging You can find Part 1 of this series here This has happened to everyone. A colleague walks into your space, erases your white board and starts scribbling on it. They say, “Hey, I’ve got this problem, and I wanted to know if you could help me with it,” followed by five minutes of boxes and circles and arrows. And then comes, “Oh yeah, I see the problem!

item.title: Thoughts on Debugging, Part 1
item.description: tags: iOS Mac Leveling\ Up Debugging claimer and link You can find Part 2 of this series here Im told Im a pretty good debugger. Friends come to me to help solve software problems. And occasionally it works. But what is a good debugger? What is debugging? Making software run better? Reducing the entropy of the universe? We all know what “Debugging” is because we all do it, but it’s still an interesting question.
